option.name: wxDV_SINGLE
option.help: Single selection mode. This is the default.

option.name: wxDV_MULTIPLE
option.help: Multiple selection mode.

option.name: wxDV_ROW_LINES
option.help: Use alternating colours for rows if supported by platform and theme. Currently only supported by the native GTK and OS X implementations but not by the generic one.

option.name: wxDV_HORIZ_RULES
option.help: Display the separator lines between rows

option.name: wxDV_VERT_RULES
option.help: Display the separator lines between columns.

option.name: wxDV_VARIABLE_LINE_HEIGHT
option.help: Allow variable line heights. This can be inefficient when displaying large number of items.

option.name: wxDV_NO_HEADER
option.help: Do not show column headers (which are shown by default).

event.name: wxEVT_DATAVIEW_ITEM_ACTIVATED
event.help: This event is triggered by double clicking an item or pressing some special key (usually 'Enter') when it is focused.

event.name: wxEVT_DATAVIEW_ITEM_START_EDITING
event.help: This event can be vetoed in order to prevent editing on an item by item basis.

event.name: wxEVT_DATAVIEW_ITEM_CONTEXT_MENU
event.help: Generated when the user right clicks inside the control. Notice that this menu is generated even if the click didn't occur on any valid item, in this case wxDataViewEvent::GetItem() simply returns an invalid item.

event.name: wxEVT_DATAVIEW_COLUMN_HEADER_RIGHT_CLICK
event.help: Notice that currently this event is not generated in the native OS X versions of the control.

option.name: wxDV_SINGLE
option.help: Single selection mode. This is the default.

option.name: wxDV_MULTIPLE
option.help: Multiple selection mode.

option.name: wxDV_ROW_LINES
option.help: Use alternating colours for rows if supported by platform and theme. Currently only supported by the native GTK and OS X implementations but not by the generic one.

option.help: Display the separator lines between rows

option.name: wxELLIPSIZE_NONE
option.help: Don't ellipsize the text at all.

option.name: wxELLIPSIZE_START
option.help: Put the ellipsis at the start of the string, if the string needs ellipsization.

option.name: wxELLIPSIZE_MIDDLE
option.help: Put the ellipsis in the middle of the string, if the string needs ellipsization.

option.name: wxELLIPSIZE_END
option.help: Put the ellipsis at the end of the string, if the string needs ellipsization.

option.name: wxELLIPSIZE_NONE
option.help: Don't ellipsize the text at all.

option.name: wxELLIPSIZE_START
option.help: Put the ellipsis at the start of the string, if the string needs ellipsization.

option.name: wxELLIPSIZE_MIDDLE
option.help: Put the ellipsis in the middle of the string, if the string needs ellipsization.

option.name: wxELLIPSIZE_END
option.help: Put the ellipsis at the end of the string, if the string needs ellipsization.

property.name: rows
property.help: Number of Rows.

property.name: cols
property.help: Number of Columns.

property.name: editing
property.help: Allow editing grid contents.

property.name: grid_lines
property.help: Show grid lines.

property.name: grid_line_color
property.help: The colour used to draw grid lines.

property.name: drag_grid_size
property.help: Allow sizing rows and columns by dragging gridlines.

property.name: margin_width
property.help: Sets the extra width to display arouned the grid.

property.name: margin_height
property.help: Sets the extra height to displaye around the grid.

property.name: native_col_header
property.help: If true, a wxHeaderCtrl is used instead to display the column labels instead of drawing them in wxGrid code itself.

property.name: native_col_labels
property.help: If true, column labels use a native look by calling wxRendererNative::DrawHeaderButton() internally. This option is ignored if native_col_header is set to true.

property.name: label_bg
property.help: Background color for row and column labels.

property.name: label_font
property.help: Font for row and column labels.

property.name: label_text
property.help: Colour for row and column label text.

property.name: cell_bg
property.help: Default cell background color.

property.name: cell_fit
property.help: Specifies the default behaviour of the cell contents if it doesn't fit into the available space. Available since wxWidgets 3.1.4.

property.name: cell_font
property.help: Default cell font.

property.name: cell_text
property.help: Default cell text color.

property.name: cell_horiz_alignment
property.help: Default horizontal alignment of cell values.

property.name: cell_vert_alignment
property.help: Default vertical alignment of cell values.

property.name: col_label_values
property.help: List of column labels.

property.name: column_sizes
property.help: List of column sizes.

property.name: default_col_size
property.help: Sets the default width for columns in the grid. Ignored unless a positive value is set.

property.name: autosize_cols
property.help: Automatically sizes all columns to fit their contents. Ignored if default_col_size is set to a positive value

property.name: drag_col_move
property.help: Allow moving columns by dragging.

property.name: drag_col_size
property.help: Allow sizing columns by dragging.

property.name: col_label_size
property.help: Height of column labels. If height equals -1 then height is calculated automatically so that no label is truncated.

property.name: col_label_horiz_alignment
property.help: Horizontal alignment of column label text.

property.name: col_label_vert_alignment
property.help: Vertical alignment of column label text.

property.name: row_label_values
property.help: List of row labels.

property.name: row_sizes
property.help: List of row sizes.

property.name: default_row_size
property.help: Sets the default height for rows in the grid. Ignored unless a positive value is set.

property.name: autosize_rows
property.help: Automatically sizes all rows to fit their contents. Ignored if default_row_size is set to a positive value

property.name: drag_row_size
property.help: Allow sizing rows by dragging with the mouse.

property.name: row_label_size
property.help: Width of row labels. If width equals -1 then width is calculated automatically so that no label is truncated.

property.name: row_label_horiz_alignment
property.help: Horizontal alignment of row label text.

property.name: row_label_vert_alignment
property.help: Vertical alignment of row label text.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_CELL_LEFT_CLICK
event.help: The user clicked a cell with the left mouse button.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_CELL_RIGHT_CLICK
event.help: The user clicked a cell with the right mouse button.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_CELL_LEFT_DCLICK
event.help: The user double-clicked a cell with the left mouse button.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_CELL_RIGHT_DCLICK
event.help: The user double-clicked a cell with the right mouse button.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_LABEL_LEFT_CLICK
event.help: The user clicked a label with the left mouse button.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_LABEL_RIGHT_CLICK
event.help: The user clicked a label with the right mouse button.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_LABEL_LEFT_DCLICK
event.help: The user double-clicked a label with the left mouse button.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_LABEL_RIGHT_DCLICK
event.help: The user double-clicked a label with the right mouse button.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_CELL_CHANGED
event.help: The user changed the data in a cell.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_SELECT_CELL
event.help: The user moved to, and selected a cell.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_EDITOR_HIDDEN
event.help: The editor for a cell was hidden.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_EDITOR_SHOWN
event.help: The editor for a cell was shown.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_COL_SIZE
event.help: The user resized a column by dragging it.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_ROW_SIZE
event.help: The user resized a row by dragging it.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_RANGE_SELECT
event.help: The user selected a group of contiguous cells.

event.name: wxEVT_GRID_EDITOR_CREATED
event.help: The editor for a cell was created.

property.name: bitmap
property.help: This is the bitmap shown in the default state, it must be always valid while all the other bitmaps are optional and don't have to be set.

option.name: wxPG_EX_INIT_NOCAT
option.help: Speeds up switching to wxPG_HIDE_CATEGORIES mode. Initially, if wxPG_HIDE_CATEGORIES is not defined, the non-categorized data storage is not activated, and switching the mode first time becomes somewhat slower. wxPG_EX_INIT_NOCAT activates the non-categorized data storage right away. IMPORTANT NOTE: If you do plan not switching to non-categoric mode, or if you don't plan to use categories at all, then using this style will result in waste of resources.

option.name: wxPG_EX_HELP_AS_TOOLTIPS
option.help: Show property help strings as tool tips instead as text on the status bar.

option.name: wxPG_EX_NATIVE_DOUBLE_BUFFERING
option.help: Allows relying on native double-buffering.

option.name: wxPG_EX_AUTO_UNSPECIFIED_VALUES
option.help: Set this style to let user have ability to set values of properties to unspecified state. Same as setting wxPG_PROP_AUTO_UNSPECIFIED for all properties.

option.name: wxPG_EX_WRITEONLY_BUILTIN_ATTRIBUTES
option.help: If this style is used, built-in attributes (such as wxPG_FLOAT_PRECISION and wxPG_STRING_PASSWORD) are not stored into property's attribute storage (thus they are not readable). Note that this option is global, and applies to all wxPG property containers.

option.name: wxPG_EX_MULTIPLE_SELECTION
option.help: Allows multiple properties to be selected by user (by pressing SHIFT when clicking on a property, or by dragging with left mouse button down).

option.name: wxPG_EX_ENABLE_TLP_TRACKING
option.help: This enables top-level window tracking which allows wxPropertyGrid to notify the application of last-minute property value changes by user. This style is not enabled by default because it may cause crashes when wxPropertyGrid is used with wxAUI or similar system. If you are not in fact using any system that may change wxPropertyGrid's top-level parent window on its own, then it is recommended to enable this style.

event.name: wxEVT_PG_CHANGING
event.help: Property value is about to be changed. Use wxPropertyGridEvent::GetValue() to take a peek at the pending value, and wxPropertyGridEvent::Veto() to prevent change from taking place, if necessary.

event.name: wxEVT_PG_CHANGED
event.help: Property value is modified.

property.name: show_header
property.help: Show or hide the property grid header control.

event.name: wxEVT_PG_CHANGING
event.help: Property value is about to be changed. Use wxPropertyGridEvent::GetValue() to take a peek at the pending value, and wxPropertyGridEvent::Veto() to prevent change from taking place, if necessary.

event.name: wxEVT_PG_CHANGED
event.help: Property value is modified.

property.name: var_name
property.help: Instance name.

property.name: label
property.help: Label shown as a tooltip of the manager's tool button.

property.name: bitmap
property.help: Bitmap shown in the property manager's header.

property.name: var_name
property.help: Instance name and an internal name of the property item.

property.name: label
property.help: Label shown in parent property grid/page.

property.name: type
property.help: Type of the property item.

property.name: help
property.help: Text to display in help description box.

property.name: var_name
property.help: Instance name and an internal name of the property category.

property.name: label
property.help: Label shown in parent property grid or page.

property.name: help
property.help: Text to display in help description box.

event.name: wxEVT_TREE_GET_INFO
event.help: Request information from the application.

event.name: wxEVT_TREE_SET_INFO
event.help: Information is being supplied.

event.name: wxEVT_TREE_ITEM_GETTOOLTIP
event.help: The opportunity to set the item tooltip is being given to the application (call wxTreeEvent::SetToolTip). Windows only.

event.name: wxEVT_TREE_STATE_IMAGE_CLICK
event.help: The state image has been clicked. Windows only.

event.name: wxEVT_TREELIST_SELECTION_CHANGED
event.help: In the single selection case the item indicated by the event has been selected and previously selected item, if any, was deselected. In multiple selection case, the selection of this item has just changed (it may have been either selected or deselected) but notice that the selection of other items could have changed as well, use wxTreeListCtrl::GetSelections() to retrieve the new selection if necessary.

event.name: wxEVT_TREELIST_ITEM_EXPANDING
event.help: This event is sent before the expansion occurs and can be vetoed to prevent it from happening.

event.name: wxEVT_TREELIST_ITEM_EXPANDED
event.help: This event is sent after the expansion occurs and can't be vetoed.

event.name: wxEVT_TREELIST_ITEM_CHECKED
event.help: You can use wxTreeListCtrl::GetCheckedState() to retrieve the new item state and wxTreeListEvent::GetOldCheckedState() to get the previous one.

event.name: wxEVT_TREELIST_ITEM_ACTIVATED
event.help: Generated when the user double clicks the item or activating it from the keyboard.

event.name: wxEVT_TREELIST_COLUMN_SORTED
event.help: The event doesn't carry the sort direction, use GetSortColumn() method if you need to know it.

property.name: label
property.help: The column label.

property.name: width
property.help: The width of the column in pixels or the special -2 value indicating that the column should adjust to its contents. Notice that the first column is special and will be always resized to fill all the space not taken by the other columns, i.e. the width specified here is ignored for it.

property.name: alignment
property.help: Alignment of both the column header and its items.
